# GT
```{r}
# Helper function: scale a vector to [new_min, new_max]
scale_to_range <- function(x, new_min, new_max) {
  (x - min(x)) / (max(x) - min(x)) * (new_max - new_min) + new_min
}

# 1. Parameter settings
set.seed(123)
years <- 3
weeks_per_year <- 52
Time_len <- years * weeks_per_year
t <- seq_len(Time_len)
week <- ((t - 1) %% weeks_per_year) + 1

# 2. Seasonal component: Gaussian peak each year around week 15
seasonal_amp <- 5
seasonal_center <- 15
seasonal_width <- 4
seasonal <- seasonal_amp * exp(-((week - seasonal_center)^2) / (2 * seasonal_width^2))

# 3. Outbreak component: larger Gaussian peaks in years 1 & 3 during Marâ€“May
outbreak_amp <- 40
outbreak_width <- 2
peak1 <- seasonal_center
peak3 <- seasonal_center + 2 * weeks_per_year
outbreak <- outbreak_amp * (
  exp(-((t - peak1)^2) / (2 * outbreak_width^2)) +
    exp(-((t - peak3)^2) / (2 * outbreak_width^2))
)

# 4. Combine with heteroscedastic noise to form covariate X1
alpha_noise <- 2
beta_noise <- 0.05
noise_sd <- alpha_noise + beta_noise *  outbreak
covariate_raw <- outbreak + rnorm(Time_len, mean = 0, sd = noise_sd)
X1 <- round(pmin(100, pmax(0, covariate_raw)))  # truncate to [0,100] and round

# 5. Simulate time-varying coefficient beta_t via AR(1) and scale to [0.02, 0.04]
mean_beta <- 0.1
rho_beta <- 0.9
sigma_beta <- 0.02
beta_t <- numeric(Time_len)
beta_t[1] <- rnorm(1, mean = mean_beta, sd = sigma_beta)
for (i in 2:Time_len) {
  beta_t[i] <- rho_beta * beta_t[i - 1] +
    (1 - rho_beta) * mean_beta +
    rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sigma_beta)
}
beta_t <- scale_to_range(beta_t, 0.05, 0.1)

# 6. Simulate AR(1) residual eta_t
rho_eta <- 0.8
sigma_eta <- 0.5
eta <- numeric(Time_len)
eta[1] <- rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sigma_eta)
for (i in 2:Time_len) {
  eta[i] <- rho_eta * eta[i - 1] + rnorm(1, mean = 0, sd = sigma_eta)
}

# 7. Construct raw_log_lambda and exponentiate to get lambda
beta0 <- 2
ZT <- (X1 - mean(X1)) / sd(X1)  # standardize covariate
raw_log_lambda <- beta0 + beta_t * ZT + eta + seasonal
lambda <- exp(raw_log_lambda)

# 8. (Optional) Visualize the components and lambda
par(mfrow = c(4, 1), mar = c(4, 4, 2, 1))
plot(t, X1, type = "l", col = "blue", main = "Covariate X1 (Seasonal + Outbreak)",
     ylab = "X1", xlab = "Time")
plot(t, seasonal, type = "l", col = "green", main = "Seasonal Component",
     ylab = "seasonal", xlab = "Time")
plot(t, outbreak, type = "l", col = "red", main = "Outbreak Component",
     ylab = "outbreak", xlab = "Time")
plot(t, lambda, type = "l", col = "darkgreen", main = expression(lambda[t]),
     ylab = expression(lambda[t]), xlab = "Time")

cor(ZT,lambda)
```

### Simulation

```{r}
params_b_ou_FR <- list(
  data = list(
    alpha_lamb = alpha_lamb,
    beta_lamb  = beta_lamb,
    T       = Time_len,
    date_start = as.Date("2024-01-01"),
    D = D
  ),
  q_model = list(
    method        = "b_ou",
    method_params = list(theta_logb = 0.3, mu_logb = log(0.7), init_logb = log(0.7), sigma_logb = 0.5,
                         theta_logitphi = 0.3, mu_logitphi = 1, init_logitphi = 1, sigma_logitphi = 0.4)
  )
)
b_ou_FR <- simulateData(params_b_ou_FR)
par(mfrow = c(2, 1))
plot(b_ou_FR$b, pch = 19, type = "b")
plot(b_ou_FR$phi, pch = 19, type = "b")

par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
matplot(t(b_ou_FR$q), type = "l", lty = 1, ylim = c(0, 1))

cor(X1, b_ou_FR$case_true)

b_ou_FR$case_true = b_ou_FR$case_true+1
```

### Model fitting

```{r}
ind = seq(10,151, by = 20)
varnames <- list()
vanilla <- list()

hypers = hypers_q(phi_ref = 0.2, D_ref = 15, type = "exponential", alpha_phi = 1.4, sd_log_b = 1, delay_seq = 0:15)
for (i in 1:length(ind)) {
  print(paste0("The ",i,"th simulation."))
  stan_data <- c(list(T = ind[i], D = D, Y = b_ou_FR$case_reported_cumulated[1:ind[i], ]), hypers)
  test = model$sample(
    data = stan_data,
    iter_sampling = 3000,
    iter_warmup = 2000,
    chains = 1,
    refresh = 0,
    thin = 1)
  varnames[[i]] <- test$summary()$variable
  vanilla[[i]] <- test$summary(variables = "N")$mean
}


```

```{r}
ind = seq(10,151, by = 20)
varnames_GT <- list()
withGT <- list()
hypers = hypers_q(phi_ref = 0.2, D_ref = 15, type = "exponential", alpha_phi = 1.4, sd_log_b = 1, delay_seq = 0:15)
for (i in 1:length(ind)) {
  print(paste0("The ",i,"th simulation."))
  w = rep(1:P,3)[1:ind[i]]
  stan_data_GT <- c(list(T = ind[i], D = D, Y = b_ou_FR$case_reported_cumulated[1:ind[i], ]), hypers, 
               list(K = ncol(matrix(ZT)), X = as.matrix(matrix(ZT)[1:ind[i], 1]),
                    P = 52, w=w))
test_GT = model_GT$sample(
    data = stan_data_GT,
    iter_sampling = 3000,
    iter_warmup = 2000,
    chains = 1,
    refresh = 500,
    thin = 1)
  varnames_GT[[i]] <- test_GT$summary()$variable
  withGT[[i]] <- test_GT$summary(variables = "N")$mean
}
```
```{r}
vanilla_combined <- list()
withGT_combined <- list()
for (i in 1:(length(ind)-1)) {
    print(paste0("The ",i,"th simulation."))
  print(error_metrics(vanilla[[i+1]], b_ou_FR$case_true[1:ind[i+1]]))
  print(error_metrics(withGT[[i+1]], b_ou_FR$case_true[1:ind[i+1]]))
  vanilla_combined[[i]] <- as.data.frame(error_metrics(vanilla[[i+1]], b_ou_FR$case_true[1:ind[i+1]]))
  withGT_combined[[i]] <- as.data.frame(error_metrics(withGT[[i+1]], b_ou_FR$case_true[1:ind[i+1]]))
}

mean_vanilla_combined <- Reduce(`+`, vanilla_combined) / length(vanilla_combined)
mean_withGT_combined <- Reduce(`+`, withGT_combined) / length(withGT_combined)

mean_vanilla_combined
mean_withGT_combined
```

### Model fitting

```{r}
ind = 40
hypers = hypers_q(phi_ref = 0.2, D_ref = 15, type = "exponential", alpha_phi = 1.4, sd_log_b = 1, delay_seq = 0:15)
stan_data <- c(list(T = ind, D = D, Y = b_ou_NFR$case_reported_cumulated[1:ind, ]), hypers)

test = model$sample(
    data = stan_data,
    iter_sampling = 3000,
    iter_warmup = 3000,
    chains = 1,
    refresh = 0,
    thin = 1)
varnames <- test$summary()$variable

mcmc_areas(test$draws("sigma_log_b"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("sigma_logit_phi"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("theta_log_b"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("theta_logit_phi"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)

mcmc_areas(test$draws("mu_log_b"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("mu_logit_phi"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)

mcmc_areas(test_GT$draws("beta_0"), prob = 0.95, prob_outer = 0.95)

param_true = tibble(
    parameter = grep("^b\\[.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE),
    x = b_ou_NFR$b[1:ind]
)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("b"), prob_outer = 0.95) +
    geom_point(aes(x = x), param_true, color = "red", size = 1)

param_true = tibble(
    parameter = grep("^phi\\[.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE),
    x = b_ou_NFR$phi[1:ind]
)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("phi"), prob_outer = 0.95) +
    geom_point(aes(x = x), param_true, color = "red", size = 1)

param_true = tibble(
    parameter = grep("^lambda\\[.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE),
    x = b_ou_NFR$lambda[1:ind]
)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("lambda"), prob_outer = 0.95) +
    geom_point(aes(x = x), param_true, color = "red", size = 1)

param_true = tibble(
    parameter = grep("^q\\[10,.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE),
    x = b_ou_NFR$q[10,]
)
mcmc_areas(test$draws(grep("^q\\[10,.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE)), prob_outer = 0.95) +
    geom_point(aes(x = x), param_true, color = "red", size = 1)

param_true = tibble(
    parameter = grep("^N\\[.+\\]$", varnames, value = TRUE),
    x = b_ou_NFR$case_true[1:ind, 1]
)
mcmc_areas(test$draws("N"), prob_outer = 0.95) +
    geom_point(aes(x = x), param_true, color = "red", size = 1)
```
